The art is absolutely amazing, the story could only be rivaled by some of the best triple-A gaming titles, and the sound design alone makes you tear up. The ending deserves every award known to man. title.label: 5 STAR GAME!!... on my PC. I LOVE this game, BUT...

content.label:
(TL;DR - great game when not played on iOS, based on my experience playing this on my iphone and ipad, for reasons of haggard audio & financial-fracturing system. I‚Äôm not sure how the rest of it plays on iOS as I couldn‚Äôt get past the intro, but this game is a safe bet on a gaming console / PC.) 

Seriously this is one of, if not THE, best WW1 game I‚Äôve ever played. 

iOS audio is absolutely *horrid* - please tell me I‚Äôm not alone in this? My ‚Äò17 iPad Pro and 8+ each have horrific audio with this game - i honestly couldn‚Äôt even get past the opening scene, and i really wish i could play this again... satisfactorily. Contentedly.

Is good audio an extra purchase, as well?

You guys went the cheap-mode route, marketing to middleschool-minds route, and actually made this game ‚ÄúFREE‚Äù ... which means you have to buy the real game INSIDE the game that‚Äôs allegedly free. Right, something like that? Dudes, that‚Äôs some cheap AF foreign-made &/or gradeschool-made &/or hacker-bait-sh**-made nonsense that anyone with ... literally, ANY sense avoids TF out of if they‚Äôre awake and sober. 

And thus, you splitteth a single game into multiple parts ... just like the other click-baiting titles.. may as well add the gold coins and purple gems for purchasing super elite upgrades for our different characters üôÑ

Come on. You guys have (had?) class. That‚Äôs what i remember this game as - it‚Äôs classy and clean and fun and extremely enveloping  as it is touching and heart wrenching and, for the most part, objective (IMO) - it‚Äôs great playing through each side‚Äôs eyes. It wasn‚Äôt overly dramatic, and despite its simplicity, the characters still grab you with their depth. 

Please just make it a single, clean purchase again.. or at least have a second release of this game that offers just one simple, clean purchase and that‚Äôs it - our deal is done. We no longer have to be on the verge of these potential purchases, and i can actually believe that the historical notifications y‚Äôall send are genuinely generous instead of ... well you get it by now. 

Personally i think any additions should simply be added to the purchase, as that makes the customers happier which has insanely positive consequences for your app‚Äôs reputation. And it just makes the app look and feel better and better. 

Make it a 4.9. Y‚Äôall easily have that potential. Knock off the nonsense. Update the audio, make it a single purchase, & you‚Äôll have a returning fan who speaks highly of the game to everyone i know.
I love this game so much that I really want to thank Ubisoft for putting a lot of effort to putting together a game that is challenging and true facts about WW 1 but the ending is so so sad

title.label: Really awesome! But some Pros and Cons.

content.label: Well. It finally came! I have been so pumped for the iPad version of this game. But some things kinda tick me off. So first come the good stuff bout the game. It‚Äôs really good and the story Is Outstanding! But now here comes the things that Make me really Dissapointed. You can play the first chapter called ‚ÄúDark a Clouds‚Äù but the other chapters you have to pay at least 3.99 for EACH CHAPTER. That‚Äôs what really makes me mad. I, a person who is really into WW1 and 2 is pretty saddened by this. But otherwise this game is great and recommended to play if you have the money to. I understand you guys have to get money one way or another, but maybe do lower the price of chapters maybe? Like chapter two you know like 0.99 then chapter two 2.00 and so on and so forth. Anyways love this game a lot!
There is some kind of weird glitch that makes the game do weird noises may someone fix this P.S. this is a good game and I love WW1 and WW2!

title.label: THIS IS A GAME DONE RIGHT

content.label: Not too often do you come across good mobile games you are lucky to find a hidden gem here and there. BUT this my friend is a DIMOND. I love how the music told you when the bombs and machine guns would come. I recommend this game 100%!

title.label: I wish I could give this game 10/5 stars

Alright so this is honestly one of my favorite WW1 games as it is educational and fun. But, Why did you have to make the game seven dollars? I would understand if you made it one dollar for each chapter but, Seven dollars is way to much. But, The game is really amazing and I would recommend playing it. Over this, I think you missed an opportunity to include the famous ‚ÄúChristmas Truce‚Äù I mean come on, It is famous for a reason it‚Äôs the most unique thing that has ever happened in war.
Overall, This game is amazing. I would 100 % Recommend playing this. 

(I have a suggestion, I think you should make another game that is basically this but in the timeline of the Second World War. I would definitely pay the price of 3 dollars on each chapter.)

This might sound like it‚Äôs not a big deal, but it really is for this game specifically. My audio, with or without headphones, rapidly skips for the music and dialogue. It totally takes you out of the game‚Äôs atmosphere. There‚Äôs also no subtitles, so playing without sound means you get nothing from the game (not recommended anyway because the sound is a big part of the game). I just had to get rid of the game because I couldn‚Äôt play it in its current state and the support system is useless. A real shame, because I know what the game is and I actually would have enjoyed it
